Module library

source code

xforms-python Python wrapper for XForms (X11) GUI C toolkit library using ctypes

Copyright (C) 2009 Luca Lazzaroni "LukenShiro" <lukenshiro@ngi.it>

This program is free software: you can redistribute it and/or modify it under the terms of the GNU Lesser General Public License as published by the Free Software Foundation, version 2.1 of the License.

This program is distributed in the hope that it will be useful, but WITHOUT ANY WARRANTY; without even the implied warranty of MERCHANTABILITY or FITNESS FOR A PARTICULAR PURPOSE. See the GNU Lesser General Public License for more details.

You should have received a copy of the GNU LGPL along with this program. If not, see <http://www.gnu.org/licenses/>.

See CREDITS file to read acknowledgements and thanks to XForms, ctypes and other developers.

Version: 0.3.1_1.0.93pre2

Function Details [hide private]

warn_deprecated_function(altfunc='')

source code 

Warns the user when a function is deprecated and should not be used anymore. If a param is provided it may advide the user about an alternative function.

fl_add_io_callback(fd, mask, py_IoCallback, data)

source code 

Registers an input callback function when input is available from fd.

Parameters:
  • fd - a valid file descriptor in a *nix system
  • mask - under what circumstance the input callback should be invoked (i.e. FL_READ, FL_WRITE or FL_EXCEPT)
  • py_IoCallback - python function to be invoked under mask condition, fn(num, ptr_void)
  • data - argument to be passed to function

fl_remove_io_callback(fd, mask, py_IoCallback)

source code 

Removes the registered callback function when input is available from fd.

Parameters:
  • fd - a valid file descriptor in a unix system
  • mask - under what circumstance the input callback should be removed (i.e. xfc.FL_READ, xfc.FL_WRITE, xfc.FL_EXCEPT)
  • py_IoCallback - python function to be removed under mask condition, fn(num, ptr_void)

fl_add_signal_callback(sglnum, py_SignalHandler, data)

source code 

Handles the receipt of a signal by registering a callback function that gets called when a signal is caught (only 1 function per signal)

Parameters:
  • sglnum - signal number (e.g. SIGALRM, SIGINT, etc.)
  • py_SignalHandler - python function to be invoked after catching the signal, fn(num, ptr_void)
  • data - argument to be passed to function

fl_remove_signal_callback(sglnum)

source code 

Removes a previously registered callback function related to a signal.

Parameters:
  • sglnum - signal number (e.g. SIGALRM, SIGINT, etc.)

fl_signal_caught(sglnum)

source code 

Informs the main loop of the delivery of the signal signum, the signal is received by the application program

Parameters:
  • sglnum - signal number (e.g. SIGALRM, SIGINT, etc.)

  • flag - flag (0|1)

fl_set_object_return(pObject, when)

source code 

Function for setting the conditions under which an object gets returned (or its callback invoked). If the object has to do additional work on setting te condition (e.g. it has child objects that also need to be set) it has to set up it's own function that then will called in the end. This function should only be called once an object has been created completely!

Parameters:
  • pObject - pointer to object
  • when - return type
Returns: ID num
